title: Using `JPA` helper class stand alone. without injecting `JPAApi`
body:
### Play Version (2.6.0)

### API Java)

### Operating System (Ubuntu 17.04)

### JDK (Oracle 1.8.0_131)

### Expected Behavior

Using `JPA` helper class stand alone. without injecting `JPAApi`


### Actual Behavior
**It seems that creating entity manager using DI has some problems in play 2.6**
I have a very very simple database access :
```
@Transactional
public class HomeController extends Controller {

    public Result index() {
        JPA.em().find(Person.class, 1L);
        return ok(views.html.index.render());
    }

}
```

while, surprisingly adding unused `JPAApi` inject resolves this problem:
```
@Transactional
public class HomeController extends Controller {
    @Inject
    public HomeController(JPAApi jpaApi) {
    }
    public Result index() {
        JPA.em().find(Person.class, 1L);
        return ok(views.html.index.render());
    }
}
```

I meet this issue when I am try to update my play version from 2.5 to 2.6
